review_title: Excellent place to work and live
pros: Wonderful community of faith and scholarship embedded in a small town community.
cons: Atchison is a smaller town, so there is not much available outside of the college, but larger cities such as Kansas City and St. Joseph are nearby.

pros: Its a good school and growing fast

pros: Small town Catholic culture. Beautiful campus. Very conservative. Pro life emphasis. Accepts all applicants.
cons: People lack integrity. Cheating problem across campus. Discriminating actions. Sweep problems under rug. Grade inflation.

review_title: The most stressful, least effective environment I have ever worked in
job_title: Mid-Level Staff Position in Atchison, KS
pros:
Engaged and friendly teaching faculty

Many many good, hard working people on the staff side in lower positions

Close community and relaxed atmosphere much of the time
cons:
Corruption from the CFO level on down

The worst style of helicopter management

Lifelong employees hired on family connections with no motivation or qualification

Pandering to a conservative student body has lead to the hiring of unqualified professors in subjects like biology and history

Extremely dated technological environment, poor support

Regular maintenance failures leading to flooded buildings and power outages

Boondoggle of a new building cost 10 million dollars with an entire floor devoted to the top three executives suites'

Other buildings, especially dorms, over 50 years old with no renovation. Literally falling apart

Whole school lost an entire semester's work in 2012 due to infrastructure failure

Many many teachers, staff leaving due to issues above and a generally hostile working environment

review_title: Great community where people care about you.
pros: Strongly Catholic, the people you work for and with are some of the best people I have known, very close knit community, a lot of school pride
cons: The campus is very pretty, almost too pretty, which makes me wonder why some of that money isn't being put toward scholarships instead of truckloads of mulch.  Also in my particular department I had trouble with my boss understanding the work/life balance.   Seemed to micromanage and found many nitpicky things about job performance without ever giving any affirmations on jobs done well.

review_title: Catholic residential college for the liberal arts providing students with a great education and sense of community.
job_title: Associate Professor in Kansas City, MO
pros: Faculty and Students work together well. The students are amazing.
cons: Location, small very opinionated senior faculty, campus is spread out so interaction with faculty is hard sometimes.

review_title: Great people, great place, great vision.
